headline.main: Obama Remains Confident That Court Will Uphold Health Care Law

docs.abstract: Weighing in for the first time on the Supreme Court arguments on the constitutionality of his 2010 health care law, President Obama said he was confident that the act would be upheld by the court.
docs.snippet: Weighing in for the first time on the Supreme Court arguments on the constitutionality of his 2010 health care law, President Obama said he was confident that the act would be upheld by the court.

headline.main: Why Are Women Spending More Time in Labor?

docs.abstract: Today, women spend about two hours longer in labor than their 1960s peers did. Is medical intervention the reason - and is longer labor necessarily bad?
docs.snippet: Today, women spend about two hours longer in labor than their 1960s peers did. Is medical intervention the reason - and is longer labor necessarily bad?

headline.main: On Recess, Congressional Leaders Shift Focus to Election

docs.abstract: Election year narratives are getting set for Congressional candidates. The next two weeks won't decide control of the House but they represent a new phase in the 2012 races as the campaigning gains intensity.
docs.snippet: Election year narratives are getting set for Congressional candidates. The next two weeks won't decide control of the House but they represent a new phase in the 2012 races as the campaigning gains intensity.

headline.main: One Derivatives Trade That's Now Off: Betting on the 2012 Election

docs.abstract: Financial regulators are expected to prohibit traders from betting on the outcome of the 2012 election, according to people briefed on the matter, dealing a blow to Wall Street's recent attempts to profit from politics.
docs.snippet: Financial regulators are expected to prohibit traders from betting on the outcome of the 2012 election, according to people briefed on the matter, dealing a blow to Wall Street's recent attempts to profit from politics.

headline.main: This Week in Small Business: Meet Your Start-Up Mate

docs.abstract: Y Combinator’s top 10 start-ups and small-business accounting mistakes. Plus, a business owner says he has job openings that no one is taking.
docs.snippet: Y Combinator’s top 10 start-ups and small-business accounting mistakes. Plus, a business owner says he has job openings that no one is taking.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health care reform passed this time because it hid the costs and co-opted potential critics.
docs.abstract: Ross Douthat Op-Ed column contends that the individual mandate contained within the health care reform law was politically brilliant, in that it hid the true cost of the law while gaining the support of health insurance companies; asserts that the mandate may lead to the failure of the law after court review, despite the fact that it helped its passage.
docs.snippet: Health care reform passed this time because it hid the costs and co-opted potential critics.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Congressman Paul Ryan’s budget plan, which passed with no Democratic votes, is long on promises and short on details.
docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes the budget passed by House Republicans for being long on promises and short on details, particularly in its treatment of taxes; asserts that a realistic budget would take into account the fact that higher tax revenues are necessary to address the deficit.
docs.snippet: Congressman Paul Ryan’s budget plan, which passed with no Democratic votes, is long on promises and short on details.

docs.lead_paragraph: Will its ruling in the health care case expunge judicial restraint from legal conservatism?
docs.abstract: Editorial contends that the oral arguments before the Supreme Court on the constitutionality of the health care reform law should put to rest any idea that legal conservatives are dedicated to judicial restraint; cautions that, should the court strike down the law on partisan lines, the court will mark itself as driven by politics.
docs.snippet: Will its ruling in the health care case expunge judicial restraint from legal conservatism?
